addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my singular good Lord the L. Burghley Lord high Treasuro
r
of England.

17 May
1590
M
r
Bodeley to my L.
Groninghen
./

page.lettertext:
fol.167r
It may please yo
r
L. to be advertised, that
by Letters whiche I have right nowe receaved
from
Embden
, and out of
Friseland
, it is signi-
fied unto me, that
e towne of Groeninghen
hath expelled their Lieutenant Governo
r
for
the
king
, and
e rest of
e Kinges Councel
there. They are also entred into parle with
e
states of Frise
, and there are hostages
sent from bothe sides. Of this I thought
requisit to certifie yo
r
L. w
t
all expedition,
and w
t
all to beseeche yo
w
, that if it stande
w
t
her
Ma
ties
pleasure, to write her letter to
Groeninghen, in suche sort as in former letters,
whiche I sent by an expresse messenger, was
desired, they may be sent hither w
t
all possible
speed. For the having of that place is estee-
med, a mater of greater importance to these
Provinces, then
e citie of
Andwerpe
; and
there is no man heere that douteth, but that
uppon
e sight of her Ma
ties
letter, they will
presently condescend to a good composition.
And thus I take my humble leave.
From
e
Hage
. May 17 A
o
90.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden
Tho. Bodley.
